title: Miracle on Ice player Mark Pavelich ruled incompetent to stand trial in assault case
text:
CLOSE

GRAND MARAIS, Minn. – A forward on the 1980 “Miracle on Ice” U.S. Olympic gold-medal hockey team has been found incompetent to stand trial on charges that he beat a neighbor with a metal pole.

A Minnesota judge Monday told Mark Pavelich, 61, that a psychologist’s report indicates the defendant “needs some assistance” to understand the proceedings.

Authorities allege that Pavelich attacked his friend after the two returned from fishing in August.

The Star Tribune reports the case against Pavelich was suspended as authorities petitioned to have him committed.

This undated photo provided by the Cook County Jail via the Star Tribune shows Mark Pavelich, a former professional hockey player and forward for the 1980 "Miracle on Ice" Olympic team. (Photo: AP)

Pavelich had two assists in the United States’ 4-3 win against the Soviet Union in the 1980 Olympic tournament. The USA then beat Finland to win the gold medal.

Pavelich later played in the NHL for the New York Rangers, Minnesota North Stars and San Jose Sharks.
description: Mark Pavelich, who played on 1980 Olympic hockey team, was accused of beating neighbor with metal pole; authorities petition to have him committed.
